thread.title: Grandmother who drove SUV through house back in jail
thread.title_full: Grandmother who drove SUV through house back in jail | www.kirotv.com

author: kirotv.com
title: Grandmother who drove SUV through house back in jail
text:
A grandmother who admits she was drunk and on drugs when she drove her SUV through her house and killed two relatives is back in jail.
Police booked Carol Fedigan into the King County jail Monday for violating the conditions of her release by drinking.
Prosecutors say a wearable device detected Fedigan used alcohol over a two day period earlier this month.
On Oct. 30, Fedigan is scheduled to be sentenced for a 2014 crash in which she drove her SUV through her house and into Lake Sammamish.
The crash killed her husband , David Walker, and her son-in-law, Sean Berry.
Fedigan's daughter was seriously injured.
Fedigan's three-year-old grandson was riding in her lap.
This summer, Fedigan reached a plea deal with prosecutors to amend the charges and limit her sentence to six years.
A spokesman for the King County Prosecuting Attorney's Office said Monday the violation of conditions of release is unlikely to affect the prosecutor's recommendation for prison time, because his office was already asking for the maximum allowed under the sentencing guidelines.
